stories.title: A Community Group for Web-Interoperable JavaScript Runtimes

stories.text: I have a technical training (physics and applied math), but spent most of my early career in the military (non-technical roles). I got out of the military and spent the last few years in the startup ecosystem in generalist roles. I've delivered when managing technical projects, can read/understand developer documentation pretty well, and frankly just vibe with developers so I want to make the transition into launching my own software projects. I don't necessarily want to grind in solitude as a junior dev somewhere to slowly develop my skills - I want to just full bore train in my spare time. Is that the wrong approach? If not, got any tips on where to start?
stories.title: Ask HN: What's the fastest way to get good at full stack app development?

stories.text:
I just had a customer reach out to me from Iran and I use a US corporation for my business and I know that the US has sanctions against doing business in Iran so I was wondering can you sell software to Iran or people or businesses in Iran?

I did a bit of research online but I couldn't really make sense of it and I was wondering if people here nkew clearly the answer.
stories.title: Ask HN: Can You Sell Software Licenses or SaaS Solutions to Iran?
